If I see one more person texting while driving I will pull them out of their car and beat them. I'm so sick of watching people swerve all over the road b/c they're too busy texting "lol".
However, as badly as I'd like texting banned while driving, I don't think banning the use of all devices is the answer. This mentions nothing about hands-free mode either. Why is the choice always all or nothing?
I wonder why they chose that house.
We don't have to kill the poachers! Let's just shoot them in the legs, making them immobile. Then pull out their teeth and fingernails and leave them to rot. Killing isn't always the answer.
Massive ladyboner for David Mitchell.
Is there anything she can't rock?

I never really thought about that before. and I've watched Mitchell several dozen times. It always made me sad to see Joel go, but now it's even sadder. =(

That's awesome! It's inspired me to make one for our local "work" kitties who are all feral. We feed them regularly and have caught most of them to spay/neuter. Now that WINTER IS COMING I'd like to make them some warm shelter in case they can't find their own.
Your build is so simple, I feel like I can replicate it with relative ease. Which is good b/c I'm far from handy. Cheers!
Fillion AND McHale?! Sploosh.
Yep, that's him! I've put together my own Servo and that's the exact headpiece used. Well, not the basketball dome, but the Carnival Gum dispenser. Good find!

WRITING.TITLE: Anyone have the link to the new art on the side?
WRITING.TEXT: Found the one with Walt yesterday, but i'd love to have the Jesse one.

I wish Todd had known that Walt poisoned Lydia. Maybe as Jesse strangled him... that would have been too glorious. After shooting Andrea in the head while Jesse watched helplessly, I feel it was only fair to tell him that Lydia was dying as he was being strangled.
Oh well. They both died in the end. That's all I could ask for.
I lost it here. This time, he's done on his terms.
Jesse giving Todd the Jabba death was SO satisfying.
Two hours until the final episode and this thread already has 1,300+ comments.
Solid gold.
Ooh, I didn't know that. Well now I know what to do when I win millions! I know you can't cash in that upvote, but have one any way.
Depending on the state you live in, you can choose to be anonymous. I know I'd hire a lawyer to collect my winnings on my behalf. I'd keep it as under the radar as possible.
I know it's a life-changing event and that it can be difficult to adjust, but I'm sorry. I will never feel sympathy for someone who has won millions in the lottery.
Get that man some wine before he shits himself! But seriously, very well done, ser. My hat and helm are off to you.
Was this their way of testing a potential pitch to FXX for a Dirty Randy Rafi spinoff?
I got blue clues.
I'd rather her die than get back with Joey. I mean, it's Joey!

Ugh. They didn't bother to call her something other than Hannah. They did nothing to disguise her all season. Yes, I am also surprised that Harrison didn't let the cat out of the bag concerning Hannah.
It's too late. He's already seen everything.

Maybe it was just me, but I was under the assumption that Gillian died last season. I guess she was going to shoot Rosetti up with heroine? I thought she was going to kill him, which is why I assumed that she was dead.
Oh well, the crazy lives on.
Dat Jelly

I was so excited when they introduced Bob as Saul Goodman. I thought it was a brave choice considering he's mainly in comedy. But Bob has shown his acting chops as Saul. I couldn't think of a better person to play the character.
YES! Blue wave. Do it.
I agree. And heaven knows what could potentially happen by going to prison. Seems like prisons make more criminal than turn them around.
Did anyone else notice the pancakes and fruit loops on the set of Talking Bad? I'm pretty sure that's how they got RJ to appear on the show.
I sure hope Joey dies by the end. I'll be so severely disappointed if that guy makes it through the entirety of the show.

I laughed, too. Out of sheer shock that they were actually doing it.
At what point did the producers see that part and think, "Yeah, THIS is good. THIS is good tv."
Solid work, guys.

I just don't care about the characters anymore. I don't worry for them when shit goes down, I don't hope so-in-so finds love, and I really don't care for the complete character change Dexter has made this season.
He used to be so calculating and careful. Now Vogel seems to control him like a puppet. He's a terrible Dad, as Harrison's main line in this season is reminding people of his name. I feel no chemistry between Dex and Hannah (Sorry, Yvonne- you're cute and all), and the only character that I occasionally sympathize with is Deb.
Fuck the whole Joey and Jamie thing, too. It's a cheap story arc and no one gives a shit. We could have had naked Jaime shots some other way. I didn't need to see Joey getting banged yet again.
Everyone in the series could die and my reaction would be, "Meh." The Trinity season was by far the best, and since then it has been downhill. Breaking Bad manages to keep up with good episode after good episode. It seems like the Dexter writers had a lot of other good things to work with, but chose not to. Instead, sex scene with Jaime. Sex scene with Hannah. ANNNNDDDD fill in the rest with whatever. Oh yeah, where's that cute kid? What's his name?
I'd watch that show. 3x the Nathan!
What about a moat....from the FUTURE!!!
So, is this technically a moat? Also, you should fill it with piranhas in case the wall ever broke. That'll keep those pesky Jehovah's Witnesses away.
I got one of those for Christmas. It's the best gift ever.
I had a calendar of these and Sansa in the snow is my favorite. Something so beautiful, quiet, tender and haunting about that moment she had building Winterfell in the snow. Agreed, heartbreaking.
Wow. Jesse is desperate to make some kind of amends.
I don't believe it's been released yet. Anyone else know?

Well, you obviously cared enough to downvote and comment. So you tell me who gives a fuck. And isn't this the point of r/videos? To post videos? Why all the hate, Murph? Just because I have an awesome shark balloon doesn't mean you need to be a jerk about it.
Next year... next year.
I always think about that after the fact.
Wee Monkeys!!!
I don't know if anyone else has noticed but his daughter also wears crazy prints all the time.
The best trick up Dexter's sleeve.

Problem is, I'm sure the police officer has the proof you want, not /u/Bohica_Dirtstar. And yes, Microsoft HAS ignored it. The officer has been waiting for a reply from them. I suppose if one has the money to hire a litigator, then Bohica would be set. Or he could forego all the tomfoolery in court and just buy another 360. Besides, their legal department will only speak to the officer in charge of the theft, not Bohica.
And it's not like saying "I lost my Xbox. Microsoft should find it." It was stolen. There's a bit of a difference. And how would Bohica get a copy of the warrant anyway? So, when it comes to something wreaking of bullshit, I suggest you take a big whiff of yourself.
EDIT: Thanks, /u/LinkerGuy
Or it's the ancient Indian burial ground...
I, personally, think it has to do with the lakes to the north and south of us. Also, Denton sits lower than it's surrounding areas. Maybe those factors keep a protective bubble over us?
Classic Denton move.

A friend of mine was working in a grocery store late at night. A couple of girls come in and ask him where they can find cupcake mix. He tells them the aisle where the cake mix is stocked. They come back to him 2 minutes later and inform him that he was mistaken. All they had on the shelf was cake mix.

Jericho has more audience over Firefly? Really? I find that difficult to believe. I completely disagree with the only-fans-of-Firefly-were-originally-fans crap. The majority of people I know that love the show, had never seen it before. Their fan base grows every year. The cast has mentioned it in interviews that their panel crowds get larger and larger.
